text: Lech Walesa ( (pronounced [lɛx vaˈwɛ̃sa]); born September 29, 1943) is a Polish shipyard worker, trade unionist and a politician who used to be the leader of Solidarity and the President of Poland between 1990 and 1995.http://www.biography.com/people/lech-walesa-12103200 Lech Walesa. (2014). The Biography.com website. Retrieved 09:19, Sep 22, 2014 Walesa won the Nobel Peace Prize in 1983. ==References== Category:1943 births Category:Living people Category:Knights Grand Cross of the Order of the Bath Category:Nonviolence advocates Category:Order of Merit of the Federal Republic of Germany Category:Polish Nobel Prize winners Category:Polish Roman Catholics Category:Presidents of Poland Category:Time People of the Year Category:Polish trade unionists Category:Anti-communists
title: Lech Wałęsa
